taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013
IUCN Red List (Species Assessed for Global Conservation)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Adults inhabit hill streams up to an elevation of 300 m (Ref. 4832).  Found in shaded, mid-hill clear waters with pebble or gravel substrates (Ref. 11966).  They occur in schools at the surface in small high-gradient upland streams (Ref. 12693).  They feed mainly on exogenous insects (Ref. 12693) and also on worms and crustaceans (Ref. 7020).  Not seen in markets, but popular in aquarium trade (Ref. 12693, 44325).  Aquarium keeping:  in groups of 5 or more individuals; minimum aquarium size 100 cm (Ref. 51539).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  India and Nepal to Indochina.
dataObjects.references: Talwar, P.K. and A.G. Jhingran 1991 Inland fishes of India and adjacent countries. vol 1. A.A. Balkema, Rotterdam. 541 p. (Ref. 4832)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Talwar, P.K. and A.G. Jhingran 1991 Inland fishes of India and adjacent countries. vol 1. A.A. Balkema, Rotterdam. 541 p. (Ref. 4832)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Diseases
dataObjects.description: Dactylogyrus Gill Flukes Disease. Parasitic infestations (protozoa, worms, etc.)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: The fish spawn several times with small intervalls releasing 5-20 eggs each time  (Ref. 1672). A prolific species laying over 1000 eggs (Ref. 7020).

dataObjects.title: File:Danio equipinnatus.jpg
dataObjects.description: A specimen of the fresh water fish species Devario aequipinnatus captured in the Adan River, Painganga basin, in the Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra state, India.
